image.altText: A family of five Syrian refugees sitting on a brown couch.

props.synopsis: The Alrahmo family has spent eight years making a life in Australia since fleeing war-torn Syria with their six children. Now the Bashar al-Assad regime has fallen, they finally feel safe enough to consider returning home to see loved ones.

title.children: 'The first time we felt safe': Syrian family hopeful to return after fall of Assad regime

image.altText: woman stands with mobile phone near christmas tree

props.synopsis: Kara is childless not by choice, and says with most of her friends having entered parenthood, celebrations and holidays like Christmas are some of the hardest times for her.

title.children: 'A feeling of being forgotten': Christmas when you're childless not by choice

image.altText: red tomatoes at the supermarket

props.synopsis: The price of truss tomatoes across Australia is expected to stay down in the lead up to Christmas. That might be good thing for shoppers, but some growers say they're struggling to break even.

title.children: 'There is certainly a glut': Truss tomato growers call for shoppers to help combat oversupply

image.altText: A close-up photo of Pembroke College librarian Kate Sylvia.

props.synopsis: Three years after Kate Sylvia's death from blood clots, a doctor tells an inquest he "didn't take in" notes from paramedics that she was taking the contraceptive pill.

title.children: Doctor unaware of contraceptive pill before wrongly diagnosing migraine

image.altText: A dead stingray on the shore with blue tarp over it.

props.synopsis: The new rules include stiff penalties for the inhumane treatment of sharks and rays, including the eagle rays that frequently visit Adelaide beaches, while fishing bans will be in effect for other species.

title.children: Beach 'mutilations' prompt protections for sharks and rays across SA

image.altText: Rohan Dennis outside court.

props.synopsis: Former professional cyclist Rohan Dennis reaches a plea deal with prosecutors over the crash that resulted in the death of his Olympian wife Melissa Hoskins.

title.children: Rohan Dennis pleads guilty to lesser charge over death of Olympian wife

image.altText: A model of the skull and an arm of a marsupial lion lit up by a torch, with a shadow cast on a rocky wall behind.

props.synopsis: A complete replica skeleton of Australia's largest mammalian predator can now be seen pouncing at tourists visiting South Australia's World Heritage-listed Naracoorte Caves.

title.children: Model of what may have been a real-life 'drop bear' now on display in SA

image.altText: A court sketch of a man holding a cloth, half covering his face

props.synopsis: A repeat violent offender with 'one of the worst' records seen by a Supreme Court judge will be released from prison in two days; despite admitting he may not be able to comply with a supervision order.

title.children: Violent offender repeatedly asks if he can 'stay in jail' during hearing ahead of release

image.altText: A red and white pyramid-shaped beacon surrounded on three sides by the ocean

props.synopsis: Rising sea levels, taller waves and bigger storms could lead to a South Australian icon falling into the sea in as few as five years.

title.children: Replica of Robe obelisk recommended as climate change speeds up erosion

image.altText: Pacific oyster

props.synopsis: About 70 per cent of SA's oyster breeding lines have been lost along with large numbers of fish at an SA research facility, leaving growers "desperately scrambling" to salvage their program.

title.children: Oyster spat deaths at research facility 'incredibly disappointing'

image.altText: A large blue sign that says "Police" in front of a large stone walkway.

props.synopsis: SAPOL says the move to standardise administrative front-counter services will affect 14 regional stations, including the end of 24/7 services at three, but it will put more officers on the beat.

title.children: Standardised hours at police stations a 'another kick in the guts' for regional SA, residents say

image.altText: An outback road sign that has the word "disgraceful" written in texta between the words "rough surface".

props.synopsis: A remote NSW resident whose property borders SA and Victoria thought his number was up when he had to take on a notorious dirt road after having a heart attack.

title.children: Heart attack emergency heightens calls to fix 'absolute mess' of a road

image.altText: A man in a navy suit sits in a chair as he is interviewed for television.

props.synopsis: Australia's most senior private security specialist has been targeted in raids conducted by ASIO and the Australian Federal Police that appear to have been prompted at least in part by his media appearances, including on the ABC's Four Corners program.

title.children: Ex-intelligence officer raided by ASIO after Four Corners appearance

image.altText: A tomb on fire in the middle of a maeusoleum.

props.synopsis: Syrian rebels set fire to the mausoleum containing the tomb of Hafez al-Assad, located in the Latakia heartland of Assad's Alawite community.

title.children: Rebels set alight tomb of ousted Syrian president's father

image.altText: A young child with short dark hair and a dark top stands in front of a TV.

props.synopsis: From an awkward KFC commercial to a mobile billboard for a brothel, ad complaints from 2024 give insight into the direction the industry is taking.

title.children: KFC, Budget Direct and a brothel top 2024 ad-complaints list

image.altText: Prince Abdulaziz bin Turki Al Faisal wearing white and brown robes and shawls while smiling with hands raised

props.synopsis: The Middle Eastern nation has won the right to host the tournament in 2034 despite major concerns migrant workers could die constructing the event.

title.children: Saudi Arabia to host FIFA World Cup despite sportswashing concerns

image.altText: A close-up shows a man with a dark black beard and a turban looking serious.

props.synopsis: A suicide bombing in the Afghan capital killed the Taliban's refugee minister Khalil Haqqani, according to Interior Ministry officials.

title.children: Taliban refugee minister killed in Kabul suicide bombing

image.altText: man with curly blonde hair in a suit walks out of court as cameras flash in his face

props.synopsis: A jury acquits Daniel Penny of killing Jordan Neely by putting him in a chokehold on a subway train, an incident that quickly went viral.

title.children: Ex-marine acquitted of murdering a street performer on a subway train

image.altText: Ashleigh Gardner of Australia is congratulated by teammates after dismissing Smriti Mandhana

props.synopsis: Annabel Sutherland reaches her second ODI century with a booming strike, having dragged Australia out of a tricky spot to set India 299 to win the third ODI at the WACA.

title.children: Ash Gardner sparks Indian batting collapse as Australia complete series sweep

image.altText: A woman leans forward to look at somebody to her right during a formal parliamentary gathering

props.synopsis: Philippine Vice-President Sara Duterte failed to meet with investigators over allegedly plotting to assassinate President Ferdinand Marcos Jr.

title.children: Philippine VP a no-show for questioning over alleged kill plot

image.altText: Palestinians with backpack cary household items as they flee along an unsealed road that runs between damaged buildings.

props.synopsis: At least two dozen people including women and children were killed in one of the strikes when it hit a house in Beit Lahiya, according to authorities in Gaza.

title.children: Israeli air strikes kill at least 33 Palestinians in Gaza

image.altText: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol delivers a speech from behind an official lectern.

props.synopsis: The former defence minister, who is accused of playing a lead role in the martial law operation, had attempted suicide shortly before being arrested.

title.children: South Korean police raid president's office in martial law probe

image.altText: A car being towed away.

props.synopsis: The prime minister condemns "shameless acts of violence" in Sydney's east, after a car was set alight and multiple houses were sprayed with anti-Israel graffiti.

title.children: PM says anti-Israel graffiti in Sydney aimed at 'promoting fear'

image.altText: Geminid meteor shower in Northern Hemisphere.

props.synopsis: You'll have to get up super early this weekend to catch the best glimpse of Australia's best meteor shower before the Sun rises.

title.children: The best Australian meteor shower of the year peaks this weekend. Here's how to see it

image.altText: A man in a suit speaking at a lectern.

props.synopsis: If Donald Trump's foreshadowed trade tariffs spark inflation, the Reserve Bank will be ready to act, says the deputy governor.

title.children: RBA will monitor Trump's trade tariffs for inflation risk, says deputy

image.altText: A man vaping tilts his head upwards as a plume of smoke rises from his mouth and nose.

props.synopsis: Pharmacy chain Chemist Warehouse and big tobacco have become unlikely rivals, in a battle to gain market share among Australia's nicotine-addicted smokers and vapers.

title.children: 'It's a con': Prescribed vapes set to cost taxpayers millions

image.altText: Two police officers standing at the back of a white car.

props.synopsis: Questions still remain over the death of a three-month-old baby found in a freezer on a rural New South Wales property in 2022.

title.children: Cause of death of baby found in freezer remains unknown, inquest told

image.altText: An illustration of three women looking towards the camera.

props.synopsis: For generations words like fat, obese and overweight have been thrown around like hand grenades. In medical settings, the damage dealt can last generations. And the victims are overwhelmingly female.

title.children: The hidden impact of fat shaming in Australia's medical system

image.altText: In this nature preserve in Italy it appears this red squirrel is stuck in a tree trunk.

props.synopsis: The competition, which has been going since 2015, offers a place for nature photographers to show off the amusing snapshots they've captured while documenting the natural world.

title.children: 'Stuck squirrel' chosen as the year's best wildlife comedy photo

image.altText: Robert George Greig.

props.synopsis: A Special Operations Group officer tells a coronial inquest that allegations Tasmania Police shot a fugitive and destroyed his car with fire to destroy evidence are "absolutely incorrect".

title.children: SOG cop refutes theory police shot fugitive and burnt car

image.altText: Alex Jones speaks outside the federal courthouse after a bankruptcy hearing in Houston.

props.synopsis: At the end of a lengthy two-day hearing in a Texas courtroom, Judge Christopher Lopez criticised the auction process as flawed and said the outcome "left a lot of money on the table" for families of victims of the 2012 Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting.

title.children: Judge rejects the sale of Infowars to The Onion

image.altText: The front entrance of Casuarina Prison at night as people mill around outside

props.synopsis: The coroner probing Western Australia’s first recorded death in youth detention indicates he may call for the unit where the 16-year-old self-harmed to be closed “as a matter of urgency”.

title.children: Coroner may demand youth detention wing closure as 'matter of urgency'

image.altText: Man standing with luxury car inside penthouse

props.synopsis: Melbourne businessman Adrian Portelli and his company Xclusive Tech Pty Ltd have been charged with multiple counts of conducting an unlawful lottery between 2023 and 2024 in South Australia.

title.children: Why is 'Lambo Guy' accused of running an unlawful lottery?

image.altText: Eilish Sheerin is on the move to Arden Street after being traded from Richmond.

props.synopsis: North Melbourne are not resting on their laurels after claiming their first flag in AFLW history, adding new star power and rising talent.

title.children: Why biggest coup of trade period should have opposition clubs worried
